Anna Preus is an assistant professor in the English Department at the University of Washington and director of UW’s Humanities Data Lab. Her interests include early 20th-century Anglophone literature, British publishing culture, and the digital humanities. She is a co-editor of _[The Paris Project](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https://www.paris-a-poem.com/__;!!K-Hz7m0Vt54!nR0cugMDSnt4j3Egv2zz-2wK5ZNZRbTpUcmUvMvppuWG6V7aWCiEeatIMFEzPVWxMiE3YXaAfbOc$)_, a digital edition of Hope Mirrlees’s groundbreaking modernist long poem, _Paris_, and her work has appeared or is forthcoming in _Feminist Modernist Studies_, _ELH_, _Modernism/modernity_ Print+, and the edited collection _Expressive Networks: Poetry and Platform Cultures_.
